thread.title: Why 2024 will be a good year for social workers and surveyors - The Mail
thread.title_full: Why 2024 will be a good year for social workers and surveyors - The Mail

author: Daily Mail Reporter
title: Why 2024 will be a good year for social workers and surveyors - The Mail
text: THE most in-demand employees this year will include social workers, quantity surveyors and cyber security managers, a recruitment firm is predicting. Commentary by James Esses AROUND the world, the British passport is seen as a trusted document, an arbiter of fact and reality. It records the most basic truths about our identity: name, face, age, nationality - and sex. BRITAIN is breaking an international treaty to combat violence against women because of confusion over how sex is defined in law, campaigners have warned. THE most in-demand employees this year will include social workers, quantity surveyors and cyber security managers, a recruitment firm is predicting. Top Tories’ anger after ‘toxic’ ex-aide claims PM met him secretly twice... and offered him role running election strategy KEMI Badenoch is the favourite to become the next Tory Party leader, according to a poll of members. NEARLY a third of all voters are yet to make up their minds about who is best to lead the country, offering a glimmer of hope to Rishi Sunak, a survey shows. FORMER Ukip donor Arron Banks has vowed to join Reform UK and raise £10million for the party if Nigel Farage returns to lead it. A NEW border farce may have mistakenly allowed thousands of foreign nationals to live in Britain, the Mail can reveal. THE number of migrants arriving in 2023 on small boats was down almost 36 per cent on the previous year in a boost for Rishi Sunak. JAMES Cleverly insists he wants to drive a ‘rapid reduction’ in net migration - as the first crackdown on legal routes comes into force. THE finance chief of the Daily Telegraph’s parent company is set to quit, as an investigation into the planned acquisition of the newspaper by an Abu Dhabi-backed consortium continues. A RIDE at a popular winter wonderland attraction stopped in mid-air during a power cut - leaving revellers dangling. TV MOGUL Nigel Lythgoe has denied sexually assaulting American singer Paula Abdul - describing her allegations as ‘false’ and ‘deeply offensive’. DENMARK’S queen unexpectedly announced her abdication last night - during her New Year’s Eve speech. Cilla lookalike ran the Slovak radio section during Cold War THE KGB used a former Labour candidate to orchestrate a ‘fake news’ campaign to vilify Margaret Thatcher and try to destroy her premiership. FORMER Labour leader Michael Foot and his family have previously been forced to deny rumours he had any links to Communism in the Cold War. He’s barely out of school, but this 16-year-old darts sensation could be just days away from securing world crown (and a £500,000 cheque!) IT’S a New Year tradition for thousands to flock to sign up at a gym after over-indulging at Christmas. THE crackdown on XL Bullys begins today, with the dogs now having to wear a muzzle and kept on a lead in public. POLICE are investigating a £3million payment made into scandal-hit Michelle Mone’s bank account. TOWN centres lost more than 10,000 shops in 2023 - leaving a black hole at the heart of many communities. THE UK has the highest rate of fruit and vegetable consumption in the world, with a third of adults consuming five or more portions a day. VENICE will ban large tour groups and loudspeakers in an attempt to crack down on the crowds blighting the city. FRUSTRATED patients are becoming ‘DIY doctors’ after failing to secure a face-to-face appointment with their GP. THEY rip open rubbish sacks, shriek piercingly when mating and pose a danger to pets - so it’s easy to take a dim view of urban foxes. NHS trusts have spent more than £4million on gift vouchers for staff as ‘tokens of gratitude’, an investigation has found. CAMPAIGNERS are calling for the introduction of a cheap social tariff on energy for struggling households as bills are set to rise 5 per cent from today. A CHEESE company accused of ‘castrating’ the Cerne Abbas Giant by removing the iconic chalk figure’s manhood from its packaging has bowed to pressure to reinstate it. NEW evidence from one of Prince Andrew’s accusers is due to be presented in a US court this week. QUEEN Camilla is absolutely ‘hopeless’ at mimicking characters from Harry Potter when reading to her grandchildren, she has revealed. WOMEN going through the menopause are driving private prescriptions for weight loss jabs, experts say. INVESTIGATIVE journalist John Pilger has died aged 84, his family announced yesterday. A FORMER cycling world champion has been charged with causing the death of his wife after she was hit by a pick-up truck outside their home. FOR every hour that teenagers spend playing video games, texting or scrolling social media, it takes them longer to fall asleep, a study has found. I’ll never back down, says tyrant as he hits Ukraine CHINA stepped up its rhetoric against Taiwan yesterday as president Xi Jinping vowed that the two countries will ‘surely be reunified’. THE number of 90-year-olds and over with a driving licence has doubled in a decade, prompting calls for mandatory eye tests to boost road safety. THE century since The Wind In The Willows was first published has been a sad one for the UK’s water voles - with numbers plummeting from eight million to 132,000.
